column5: All the fun I had with the whities has come to an end. Still lots of ice,so it,s perch,n time. Im not a big percher guy and I dont use live bait,so using baits not so familiar to me is a challenge. The morning was beautiful. Little wind and the sun was coming up.    Drilled my first hole and I was WT%#%$ Dirty brown water 1/2 mile out.  Moved out another 1/2 and found some water that was fishable. First fish was a dink,then the 2nd was a whopper It measured 14 1/2 on the button. Pic does not show this fish justice    Ended the morning with 6 perch. Just enough for a fresh dinner.   .
Dirty water must be from all the rain run off, some areas must have gotten a substantial dump, we got lucky, almost nothing. News showing the annual flooding around Alcona/Innisfil last night
You mean I should of hit the river instead ? LOL
That could be scary, Mad river was running across Brentwood Rd today, Notty right up to the top also.
The Queen don't eat that good, Your the man, Perch and Eggs, can't be beat
